[h1] Edit For Steam Deck users [/h1]
Having now played it on the Deck it runs suprisingly well for how much is happening on screen
what i will say is on the OLED i will drop to 22ish-25 sometimes BUT it is only for millisecond, long enough to register the drop but you dont really feel it ever if that makes sense. i think one benefit of it coming out on the Ps4 is that the 30 lock feels incredibly smooth closer to like 45 or so feels like on there. the menus are also very very snappy and the loading is like instant so that too does not feel like its taxing the system the way it is. also locked at 30 your looking at around 3-5 hours give or take with the time in cut scenes and menus probably 2 and half to 3 if you are just straight running missions non stop. 

i bought this on a whim, i liked how it looked and what i thought it was. im not familiar with granblue other than the hour i played of the most recent fighting game but ill tell ya a purchase of that is now in the future. 

this is a weird blend of Wayfinder, Xenblade chronicles and monster hunter and pretty much in that order. 

runs well for me at locked 120 fps full tilt. i dont think i ever saw a frame drop no matter how frantic it got. 
though im on a 13700k with a 4080. im curious to try it on steam deck here shortly. 

i cant say much about the story other than its totally serviceable. and overall im enjoying it even though im not totally locked into it. What i will say is this game does something ive never seen but if you skip a cutscene it gives you a summer of what your skipping and what plot is happening before you accept making it possible to fully understand it without needing to see it. that said the voice work and scenes themselves are super well animated and framed. if i was more into this style of story telling i think id like it quite a bit i just fine the Characters a bit too silly and some way to serious. i cant really find a middle ground. 

Combats great as youd expect, i could take more from the open areas because i just generally like them and the look of the game itself. but whats offered is fine so far. 

No real microtransactions, no store, no battle pass, You have a full 3d model viewer of every character, enemy and weapon in the game and one for a good chunk of the 2d art which you would see sold separate in a lot of other games now a days

i havent made it to the endgame but im incredibly curious as to what it looks like and or what a roadmap or continuation will look like going forward because i do see myself spending a good bit of time with this and i almost wish it was a live service so that i knew more was coming. 

honestly my only real gripe is that when you pick a character that is what theyre going to look like the entire time, i know people in this niche like this but i could take more outfits or look changes or something to represent my grow in power as it is a power fantasy at the end of the day. 

my only other gripe is no ultrawide support which is a bummer, weirdly the game doesnt have ps4 or 5 button layouts even though it only launched on there and pc as a port so its an odd ommission since the work was already done, but to that end the games ui and layout is exactly the same as a controller as in right hand side has a 4 button diamond for abilities and a bumper and trigger listed same as the left hand side so just looking at the screen youll know exactly where everything is when it matters. though most of us who have used a ps controller on pc for a while will be accustomed to missing button art. 

i dunno i think its good, im really surprised by it, i got tails of arise recently and i now feel like i probably wont be touching that for quite a while.

Fascinating world and charming presentation and characters, but, far be it for me to asses a game's worth solely on its lenght, but from what I have gathered, its story last little more than 10-15 hours played leisurely, whivh not only is extremely short for the genre, it is unjustified by the game's system and pacing, while for some type of games this amount of time is enough to deliver a satisfying and fulfilling experience, based on what I have played so far, this games will make you feel wanting, I feel I have barely played yet I am at a third from completion being optimistic.

According to informations acquired, the core of the game's playtime resides in the post story content, which consists of repetetitive instanced few minutes long co-op battles with recycled enemies and bosses, accompanied by grinding for new equipment with the sole purpose to takle more of this, in my opinion, vapid and uninteresting content.

I am so far enjoying the game, and I find saddening to see all this charm squandered in this manner, since in the first hour it managed to capture and fascinate me so that I thought it could have rivaled games such as Xenoblade 2, but it looks like the developers had no intention to exploint the full potential of the settings and the characters.

Very fun action RP with some of the best anime graphics I've seen in a game like this, being both flashy and retaining that classic granblue fantasy art style in a 3D environment.

Many different characters, each with a different gameplay mechanic and combos to play around with. 
Wonderful soundtrack, many referencing the tracks from the original game. 
Decent story, cliche and filled with tropes, but filled with visually appealing cutscenes. 
Lots of things to do other than the main story, questing by yourself or with friends, side quests, and I personally enjoy just levelling and gearing all the characters. 

If you're a fan of the original game, I highly recommend it. If not, the story and characters might be a bit harder to get into, but the combat and gear progression system is worth it alone imo.

This is an edited review. By giving this game a thumbs down may not serve this game a justice. But I will still warning you of a chance this game freeze on your PC!

A comprehend review will come later as i finish with the end game. But i can tell you this game is just GREAT in lot of aspect. And a lot of fun!

PS: Set priority to high in task manager seems to help with the freezes.

After having played through the story and doing some of the co-op quests, I can say that I have really enjoyed this game. The story mode has very much the feel of a classic JRPG setting, with the boss fights being pretty fun throughout the game.

I have seen mentions of the game having performance issues and crashes for some people, but I haven't had a single crash or issue through my entire playtime. Even the online co-op was very stable. I will say that the hub area does drop in fps a bit (40-ish fps was the lowest at max settings at 1440p on a RTX 3060 TI and Ryzen 5800X3D), and I think that is due to that area having a lot of NPC's and stuff on screen. Combat was always above 60 fps for me.

I would highly recommend not going for the special edition since most of what it gives you for starter items is fairly easy to obtain, not unless you really want the extra character colors.

Great game, a lot of fun. I am also a huge fan of Granblue and am excited to finally have an english release for it. The only thing I would fix is being able to play story mode in Coop once you have played through it at least once. Perhaps they will in the future? I wouldn't hold my breath for it but it would be cool. There is still a ton to do in multiplayer. All the farming and more challenging bosses are in multiplayer. Let me preface this by saying that this is my first review. Usually I am a chill dude avoiding negativity of this kind but I feel like people should be aware how the game really is because all the Youtubers are praising the game and giving the impression that this is worth your time and money; I disagree and here's why:

The game is a huge disappointment, sadly on multiple levels. Starting with how obnoxious the camera is and the related settings that do not help at all. Targeting enemies and settings related to that are very poor as well. For rest of the performance I cannot really speak of because I am brute forcing performance by using RTX4090 and i9 13900k so it runs well for me, although I can see that the GPU and CPU utilization is higher than in Cyberpunk 2077 on maxed out settings and 4k resolution so that should speak volumes I guess. Oh and BTW, did I mention that this game has no support for ultra wide monitors? Yeah, when you are running anything more than 16:9 then say hello to black bars on sides.

For the game content - story is very mediocre and the dev laziness is beyond reason. Starting in Chapter 8 or maybe even 7 (out of 9,5 chapters because last chapter can't be considered a full chapter compared to previous ones) you start seeing same bosses, just re-skinned with different color. There is of course a story reason for that but dear god does it feel cheap.

The Endgame - the what now? Oh yeah, a mindless grind to just get bigger DPS numbers and to clear encounters faster. There is zero novelty, all bosses and enemies are exactly the same, not even of different color or size. It's all a repeat from story but just harder and oh boy is the difficulty scaling really bad (beat story on Hard and it wasn't challenging at all except literally last boss that has just a silly gimmick - you have a short window to DPS down a certain thing, otherwise you wipe and need to start over the entire fight.
I had taken the effort and Googled out if there is ANYTHING new in the endgame and apparently at the very end, when you are max level already there are 3 bosses of same kind (say Hi to last chapter of the game) but they differ in color and head design, rest of the body is exactly the same.

To say that I am disappointed is understatement. Shame on you whoever made this.

Fun game. It had a rough launch with crashes on startup related to the newer intel processors that have E-cores, but they released a patch. I managed to fix the crashing before the patch, here a few things I did as a workaround:

-Install a free program Process Lasso
-Once installed, you run it, and then restart your computer. 
-In Process Lasso, disable efficiency mode for the Granblue process Always (this disables E-cores for Granblue)
-Exit any background game launchers like Riot Games or Vanguard or Battle Net launcher

The game itself is very enjoyable, as a long-time Granblue fan that's played since just before the English option was added to the main game it's been an absolute treat. The beautiful art and aesthetics, the fluid and smooth combat with all the unique character play-styles (Cagliostro my beloved) and a refreshing focus on the main characters of the crew that's kind of fallen away in the main game now there's 50000 god-like (and actual gods) on the crew. The side missions ala a Monster Hunter counter hunts with random players have been fun if a bit easy since it's low level. The translation has been a mixed bag, at times it's been normal and perfectly fitting, other times weird out-of-place zoomerisms have creeped in.

Overall Relink is, fifteen-ish hours in, so far a fantastic game.

Welcome Granblue Fantasy: Relink to the hunting genre and its here to stay -

A captivating addition to the hunting genre, this game introduces significant innovations by seamlessly integrating deep RPG mechanics. Boss fights offer a refreshing experience, emphasizing mechanical challenges over the typical hunting game formula of simply attacking and dodging. The story line is decent, though the drawback lies in its mandatory nature and the campaign being exclusively single-player. Players must invest 10-15 hours (considerably shorter if cutscenes are skipped along with side quests) in the story before delving into the Monster Hunter aspect of the game.

The end game is rich in content, providing ample opportunities for grinding. Each character boasts unique play styles, enhancing the overall gaming experience. While the game draws inspiration from Monster Hunter, its potential as a live service game is evident, and one hopes for continuous updates from CyGames. For a debut effort in this genre, the game is remarkably impressive. If you enjoyed Monster Hunter, this title offers a comparable experience expect the same grindy nature and fighting the same monsters over and over again to power up your characters. A notable strength of this game is its effective use of numerical data, immersing players in a flood of numbers that triggers a satisfying dopamine response. This aspect contributes to a game play experience reminiscent of titles like Vampire Survivors and Holocure. On my PC the experience has been excellent, with a consistent 100+ fps on a 5900x and 3080 setup. 

A+ Definitely recommend at full price. 

Steam charts and the sales for this game have been blowing up and its well deserved.

UPDATED review

Ok, I have completed the main story and many post-game quests. They also since released a patch which fixed some of the bugs I mentioned so I remove them from my cons. 

- The story is still servicable, but it does get hype at times. It is extremely cliche and predictable, and the pacing feels like it never takes the chance to slow down. Basically, expect a similar story quality to Monster Hunter, but a bit better. Mostly the story feels like giving you a reason for doing the post-game quests.
- The combat is damn fun. Each character plays differently and feels like their own class, despite all of them based on the simply X/Y combo system. Some characters care about timing, some care about how you pace your attacks, some rely on zoning, etc. You can definitely play the game without aiming for S++ rank by just doing basic X/Y combos, but just like any PlatinumGames game, to get the optimal output from your character there's a lot of deeper mechanics to consider. As an example, Katalina seems just like any other character with her X/Y combos and skills, but her special gauge can be built up quickly using optimal combos, and once her special is activated you have to chain her attacks and skills in a specific way to keep her special up for as long as possible to maximize your damage output. You also have other ways to build and maintain the gauge outside of skills, all of this comes together to feel like a dance. It's what I love about PlatinumGames games and they captured it here perfectly for a RPG skin.
- The end game is a grind, just like Nioh, just like Monster Hunter, just like any other mission based RPG. You'll be getting new mechanics each with their own grind and if you want to be optimal in the hardest content that's something you'll have to deal with.

Overall, it's what I expected and hoped for. It's a solid game.

===============================

Here is my pros and cons so far.

Pros:
- The MC is fully voiced
- VA work is good and artstyle is nice
- The combat is fun. Not groundbreaking, but fun, especially when all the systems come together
- The locations are large. Not open-world, but enough to do some exploration
- I actually like the simplified weapon upgrade system from the gacha
- I haven't run into any game breaking bugs besides the KB one

Cons:
- The backstory is delivered to you via logs and you won't understand anything unless you played the gacha or watched the anime
- The whole dispatch mission system feels disconnected from the rest of the game, it is clearly there because that's how the gacha works, but you show up in the town with the intent to save some people and the quest lady's like "yeah btw you can go on missions if you want lol"


So far it's a light recommend. I think after they fix bugs this will level out around high 80%s, it just won't appeal to many people. Might update after I play more

Combat is super fun, postgame is meaty, so many fun playstyles between all the characters, it's a ton of fun. There was already a patch that did fix some issues but there are more fixes to come. The game, similar to its mobile origins. is all about grinding. But the grind is fun.

I do think this is an easy recommend even if you're playing solo, but postgame will be much more fun with friends. However, the story is singleplayer only. Depending on if you watch cutscenes or not and how you're playing through it, it can take 8-15+ hours, so it's not terribly long at least. Even if you do play solo, recent patch seems to have improved matchmaking a bit and I don't think region lock is an issue anymore.

The game is a well polished, fun, and soulful Granblue entry. 

The only negatives are:

- The odd crash
- Localisation is AWFUL
- PC players didnt get access to a demo or early access (the excuses for this could be worked out/prompt Valve to sort this out or reduce the price to account for a lack of these features)

When this game works, it's genuinely phenomenal. Various PC related issues so I can't advise grabbing it on this platform right now, but overall, the actual experience is amazing.

Unfortunately, the fact that it does not actually launch most of the time is a huge issue. These are issues one would not accept of other games, so it is unacceptable here as well.

Edit: After a recent patch, the game appears to no longer be having horrible crashing issues and I can now gladly recommend it.

So this was a game, that i needed to really get that itch coop boss battle games and co-op role-playing. Except it's not.

The main story of this game is engaging and fun and if you like boss battles FF14 style or Monster hunter style, and you like role playing, then this is definitely the game for you.

If you wanted all  the above, and a game to play through the story with friends, This is not the game for you :). Whilst there is a co-op element to the game, it is in the same vain as monster hunter world, You have to do this alone. People can only join the side quests. This also poses a problem. So far, i have found myself queuing for a while to partake in the side quests and sometimes never finding a group. SO fa I have found me way to sign up for random quests, so it seems you gotta hope that people are doing the same quests as you, or you do it alone.

The NPC are not completely stupid though, Which makes doing the side quests easier, But kinda wish we could have a way to see who is doing what quests and join.

All in all , iam loving the game and would recommend it.

The story is mostly fine, but it's little more than just a filler arc for the original mobile game.
The combat is flashy and impactful, but the campaign is laughably easy with practically no risk of death, even on the highest difficulty.
Should the endgame prove to be appropriately challenging, I might change my review, but as it stands I find it hard to justify paying the full price for a "filler" that offers no challenge.

Edit: I have now played some "hard" and "very hard" quests in the endgame and they are pathetically easy still. The bosses have more HP sure, but it's just reskinned versions of the same bosses you have beaten ten times before. Not worth it so far...

This is the game that I wished FFXIV and Monster Hunter would be. 

It looks amazing, it has spectacular fights, and the combat is exactly what I have been looking for. Very dynamic, but doesn't require you to know how to play a piano.

The story is... Eh. It's derivative and I don't know if some of the dialogues are cringy because of localisation or because of how the story was written. It was aimed at a fairly young audience. It also has the typical anime/manga structure of always trying to one-up itself at every stage, and the final couple of chapters were exasperatingly so.

The character themselves though are really interesting and I prefer their own personal stories.

Gameplay wise the characters feel very different from one other and they are all interesting.

I experienced one crash in the middle of a cut scene in chapter 8. Otherwise it runs very well for me.

Controls are decent on mouse and keyboard, although better on controller. Even if the UI and the tutorials tell you to press an extra button to switch to your 4 skills, you do not need to do so on keyboard, just press the keybind for your skill. This aspect of the port was done with the smallest amount of effort they could get away with, so they didn't bother to change the UI or even update the tutorial for mouse and keyboard, aside from the obvious keybind changes.

The game can be absolutely enjoyed solo or with friends, the systems support both options well.

This is my first review, or perhaps a rambling rant. 
Chapter 6 Finished as of writing this.

-----SHORT SUMMARY OF MY EXPERIENCE SO FAR-----
I myself like this game, I'm very simple and easily amused when it comes to flashy combat and/or super moves and this one hits the spot of just being cathartic in a sense with how fluid it feels to play it and execute Full Bursts with bunch of strangers online.

If you ever played any mobile games or gacha at all, you will feel very familiar with some of its design and UI, specially when upgrading weapons as an example.
Level the weapon to its current Max Level -> Uncap its max Level Capacity to level it even further -> Level the weapon to the new unlocked Max Level -> Repeat -> Repeat and Repeat till its maximum. The only difference is you don't need multiple of the same weapon to do this unlike regular gacha games, just materials which you get from various quests.

Basically it has the feeling of typical gacha design, but without the gambling and few other aspects that makes it standout from your usual Gacha game that would normally "encourage" you to spend real money. I am expecting it will be some sort of grindfest at the endgame from what I've read, but not Gacha Grindy, more akin to Monster Hunter-ish, but with more special effects to rival a disco. And without the annoyance of an "Stamina/Energy" currency to interact with the game like most mobile games have of the gacha element, glad that isn't present.

That is just my current experience during story mode and the occasional side-quests, but as for the gameplay itself I'm having a blast with some of its simplicity and spectacularly fun boss fights, can more or less steamroll it like i have done if you just upgrade your stuff and know the basics while on Normal Mode. There is Journalist mode (Story Mode), Normal and Hard Mode i believe. But sometimes i like to challenge myself and get up there to Perfect parry and dodges since the buffs/benefits from it feels rewarding for pulling it off.

--The story itself can be a mixed bag due to its translation from Japanese into English, specially if you understand Japanese and it doesn't reflect the English translation by using weird slangs you normally wont hear people say like "In a jiffy" /"Exactomundo" among other things by recognizing few words and be like "That is not what he/she said at all". 
For me i am not bothered by it, all it does is make me second guess why its always so difficult for a 100% correct localization considering the universal language that is English combined with the impact Japanese media have had on the world with anime, jrpg etc, Or if someone believes that "This is exactly how people talk and behave on that side of the planet". But this type of translation isn't exclusive to this title so i can hardly judge it at all for it.
Otherwise the story isn't that big of a deal, more like a context of things till you eventually don't pay it no mind and just focus on the gameplay itself like any other games OR don't focus on the odd translations and the try to enjoy the story for what it is and the context it provides you, whichever you prefer. 
But if you played dozen of JRPG games then you will pretty much be used to the kind of story it is offering, It's nothing mindblowing or grand, but its there mostly as a drive to continue until you reach End Game content.

----MY ISSUE WITH THE GAME----
However despite enjoying this game i haven't encountered a single problem or a single crash >>"yet"<< that others are currently facing, by being unable to play a >>Full Priced Game<<. So i can't in good conscious give it a positive rating until the devs have fixed said issue.

Can't get past the company logo splash screen and crashes // Can't boot up the game // Can't get past Chapter 1 Rolan cutscene to continue main story as it freezes the game and hard crashes it // OTHER Cutscenes doing the same thing // Game stops booting at all after said cutscenes hard crashes it // Blackscreen. And whatnot, mostly it hardlocks your progression at Chapter 1 due to its issue and more then a few or dozen customers mentions this.

Normally i would just continue playing it and just have a grand ol' time even if others are having major problems while it functions for me.
BUT i did want to play it for the co-op "Monster Hunter"-ish quests with one of my friends that can't even play it because of the issues the game have since its launch and seems to persist after the recent patch today.

I am not a tech-savy in any form and just have bare minimum understanding to keep my PC running, but i do troubleshoot a ton like a possessed ghost with a grudge when something doesn't work as intended.
And this is what i have mostly come to understand:

If you as a customer wants to play the game but are unsure if you will be one of the unlucky ones unable to do so, you only need to look at one specific hardware to determine that. >>Processor<<
If its an Intel, either older or recent generation (From what I've read across multiple topics in the discussions and posted specs) you will MOST likely have a bad day and unable to play the game with that specific brand of hardware. (My is an "AMD Ryzen 7 1700", it does its job.)
There have been some exception though, but most of those have had to troubleshoot as well for a fix that works for them, and may or may not work for others, which is a gamble. 


----WHAT ARE THE FIXES?----
They vary from "I guess that make sense" to "Absurd black magic nonsense"

The most common one is by using a software called "Process Lasso" for your intel related Granblue problems, but it isn't always a 100% guarantee for everyone.
---And if you're lucky as a intel user, one of the two things might work for you with Lasso:
-1.- By just having Lasso passively running in the background and "monitoring" your cores while playing the game.
Imagine the Boo ghosts from the Mario games. It won't do you wrong if you keep your "eyes" on the cores for some reason.
-2.- By disabling "Ecores" through Lasso, which have had mixed results of either working or temporarily working up till Chapter 3 cutscenes and strokes out again.

---The second most common thing that seems to work//not work depending when it comes to the game constantly hard crashing and not booting up at all or blackscreens, which is the black magic that someone found out by accident, with mixed results as well. [Credit goes to "Valkyn Shade" for discovering this by accident]
-By BOOTING UP another game entirely first (In this case it was Monster Hunter: World), let it finish loading up till its Main Menu, AND THEN boot up "Granblue Fantasy Relink" while the other Game remains active in the background, and boom. The game is booting up, getting pass the Company splash logo, black screens etc. After that you can quit out of the other game in the background. (Unsure what it does for cutscenes, might have glanced over that if it does anything for that issue)
For him and his friends it has been a reliable to get the game running, but suggested to try with other games if you don't have MHWorld or that specific game didn't work for you.


TL:DR;
I'm having a blast playing it, but i really wanted to play this with a friend who has a Intel Processor which the game is struggling to keep itself from running stable at all. As of now NO FIXES have worked for my friend at all.
If you can't boot it up, play it or anything. There is lot of topics with obscure fixes that may or may not work for you as a Intel user. 
Just keep it in mind by using a Intel Processor if you plan to purchase it before the Devs patched a fix, there will be a high chance that you will be unable to play it till then.
So until then, my review will remain negative till such patch have been released fixing this glaring issue.

Do feel free to leave a comment of your fixes or correcting any accidental misinformation on my part!

This revised review was made after the patch of February 3, 2024. This is a review based on the build after the patch.

The launch of this game for me and many others was horrible. However, as many have pointed out, these days many games are released as buggy messes. Tekken 8 PC released with broken and unplayable online multiplayer where you would crash after matching with literally anyone. Undernight In-birth 2 is still a broken mess. Even GOTY Baldur’s Gate 3 had some problems on release where some would experience an excess increase in their gpu temperature. What is important is how fast the game developers respond to these problems. As for Granblue Fantasy Relink, I am happy to announce that at least for me, the bugs and glitches are gone.

What is Granblue Fantasy?

Granblue Fantasy is originally a mobile game released by Cygames, a company based in Japan. It features a dated turn based combat inside a rich world and a great plot that’s supported with interesting lore. There are many amazing characters too that are locked behind ‘gacha’. Personally Granblue Fantasy was a first for me. It was the first mobile game I thoroughly enjoyed. It was the first gacha game I spent money on. It was the first mobile game that forced me to team up with overseas players to participate in “Unite and Fight” events and allowed me to make foreign friends. It’s no exaggeration for me to say that I’m fluent in English now all thanks to GBF. If I didn’t know english then I wouldn’t get to banter with my western friends in our guild. So believe me when I say that this series is very dear to my heart.

What is Granblue Fantasy Relink?

Granblue Fantasy Relink is an ARPG (Action Role Playing Game). It moves away from its turn-based origins and has a multiplayer that's reminiscent of the Monster Hunter franchise. It's a work that's been in the oven for seven years and has been long awaited by fans both old and new to the series alike.

Plot:

GBFR (Granblue Fantasy Relink), does not start at the beginning of the series’ story. Instead it starts off at the 3rd major arc of the mobile game’s plot. This means for many, they will be a bit confused on why some things are the way they are. Like why are both Lyria and Djeeta (no I don’t play Gran) are life linked? What’s the deal with Vyrn? What are the Astrals? These are things someone new to the series will ask and sadly the game doesn’t really do a good job addressing these. I would suggest watching the anime or giving the mobile game a try to better understand the world’s lore.

To put it simply without spoiling anything, there’s a jerk who’s trying to revive the “Forbidden Primal Beast” which has the capability to destroy the skies. As a Skyfarer you don’t want that so you have to stop her and rescue a couple of friends along the way. If you’re someone new to the series, but not new to JRPGs, you might find this bland or a cliche. But if you’re someone who’s interested in GBF lore then your eyes will be glued to the screen for hours. If you’re not a fan of anime and constantly shit on JRPGs then head back to Yingtopia because this game is simply not for you.

Graphics and Art Design:

Granblue Fantasy Relink is a very beautiful game. The world is very nice and polished. The characters all look very beautiful both in-game and in cutscenes. I run the game in the highest settings and I find that everything is very vibrant. There were some moments where I thought ‘Djeeta looks kind of stiff’ but this was not something that ruined it for me. The monsters all look intimidating and the animations of the attacks and skills you use to vanquish them were a feast to the eyes. Personally I think this game won’t lose to any other game of the same genre in this department. And finally Cagliostro is very cute.

Audio (SFX and Soundtrack)

I cannot overstate how amazing this game’s soundtrack is. As some people already said, it would be a robbery if this does not win the award for ‘best score and music’ this year. The developers chose the perfect music to play in every situation. Fighting an epic boss has never been more hype thanks to the background music that encourages you to give god an asswhoopin. The characters are properly voice acted, even Djeeta who was originally a silent protagonist now has her own voice!

Gameplay

As I said before the game has moved away from its turn based roots, and that’s fine. It’s refreshing to see GBF in the style of monster hunter. You use the town as your hub then go out into the world to fight monsters in real time. You form a party of four from the characters that you have. The characters are diverse in skills and in looks. You can either choose to make a party depending on aesthetics, or make a party based on skills that you need to fight a boss or to suit your playstyle. Kinda reminds me of how it worked in my hometown in Fontaine.

In battle you have your attack (square), heavy attack (triangle), jump (x), and link arte (circle). You can attack enemies while jumping, which has its own set of attack animations. By pressing R1 + your action buttons you can use 4 different skills that you can customize to best suit your party. Many characters can heal, but some can also buff up the party’s attack and/or defense. There are some characters who have nothing but selfish buffs who are focused on smacking enemies silly. It’s all very fun really.

“Wow you said there are many characters? There’s only a few here! Where are they?!” Well, throughout the game you get items that are called “Crew Cards”. You trade these to Sierokarte, the annoying runt, to recruit Cagliostro and maybe other characters. This item is finite so choose properly who you like. After you recruit the character of your choice you can spend mastery points to give them new skills, and buff up their stats. You can also go to the blacksmith to outfit them with the proper weapon they can wield, upgrade these weapons and enchant them with sigils for maximum biatch slapping sensation. Personally I would save these Crew Cards in case the devs release new characters in the future.

In conclusion:

Granblue Fantasy isn’t a perfect game. It is however a very fun game that gives the mobile game’s fans what they’ve always wanted…. Seeing Ferry’s armpits in 3D.

Relink is my introduction to the GBF universe, it wasn't even on my radar until 2 peeks prior to release. You can imagine my face when I found out the game was announced back in 2016 and delayed for around half a decade. The delay was absolutely worth it as the game is an absolute masterpiece.

If you're planning on picking up Relink only to play through the story and then not touching it again I would recommend against doing that, as it was stated and pretty obvious from playing the game, the story is not the focus of the game, more so the endgame. While the story itself isn't a masterpiece, it's not bad either. If you've played any other JRPG's you'll find plenty of similarities between writing. However it is full of epic and "ooh s**t" moments.
While playing the story the captain (Gran or Djeeta) will be forced to be a part of your party, however they don't need to be the character you control. After the story is done you'll be able to remove them from the party entirely. The main campaign has no multiplayer whatsoever, which to me, is no problem at all.

Where the game really starts to shine is in its wide variety of characters, gameplay and the endgame. You have 18 characters (19 if you count Gran and Djeeta as seperate) to choose from to make a 4 man party. While the characters don't have specific roles that they should stick with, it's quite easy to see which characters are meant to be used for support, tanking or unleashing huge amounts of DPS. Every character is unique in their playstyle and not just copy paste. Because of this, if you ever get bored of playing a character, just switch it up and you'll be playing in an entirely different way with other methods of approaching your current obstacle.

For the people familiar with Monster Hunter, endgame works more or less the same, You go to the quest counter, pick up a quest, play either online or offline, complete the quest, return to town or redo it repeat.

Personally, I love grinding and min maxing characters so I'm sure I'll enjoy the endgame which I'm now headed to.

Cygames did an amazing job in making the step of leaving Gacha behind and making something completely different, which to my knowledge is their first attempt at a game like this. Well done devs.

Final verdict: Good game, but fuck the english localization!

I've been following this game ever since the first few gameplay videos were shown in 2017. The wait was definitely worth it.

> Gameplay:
The game consists of hub sections where the player unlocks various things, picks up quests and levels up characters and then goes on adventures in 4 man parties (whether it's actual players joining you or NPCs is up to you). Main missions follow a PSO / MonHun structure where there might be several smaller encounters leading up to multiple boss fights. The side missions may have more focused objectives. 

Combat is action based, very fluid and flashy. There's about twenty characters to pick from, each character having two basic modes of attack along with the standard dodge and block and an aerial attack string. Up to 4 abilities can be equipped aswell to further spice up the combos. The way the dodging is handled is quite interesting too, allowing players three consecutive dodges before ending up in a "winded" stage. Lots of characters have timing based attacks where correctly timing them affects damage or completely modifies the combo string. The "tells" for the right timing are very clear though and the only time you muck up combos is when you panic or when there's a lot of things on the screen at once.

> Story:
Very simplistic story featuring classic tropes from JRPGs varying from primal elemental beasts, big bad evil, power of friendship etc. Definitely an enjoyable ride with scenarios nicely paced. Moments of glory are intertwined with moments of respite giving you a chance to go back to hub and level up / upgrade / do side quests / do CO-OP. 

> Graphics & Performance
The models and textures are all very beautifully done, animations are super smooth and flashy, overall I really like them. On my 12600K + 3070 Ti rig the game runs incredibly well (constant 120 FPS with no drops or hickups). Also another thing I like is how they've handled LODs - they look like watercolor paintings.
I've not had a single crash but I did have a black screen on boot issue, which seems to have been fixed by the 1.0.4 update. Other than having to restart the game a few times until it boots, I've not encountered any Cyberpunk / Bethesda-esque bugs where npcs float or fall through the ground. 

> Audio
The English dub is ...servicable I guess? But then again that's always the case with JP games. Japanese voice over is amazing with some top tier VA being pulled for this game. The general audio such as effects and attack noises are done really well. Soundtrack arrangement is beautiful, with some really nice orchestral music to add to tension in battles.

> Translation
My one gripe with the game really. Millenial and zoomer lingo sprinkled in moments where it clearly isn't necessary nor does it fit the character. The localisers for Japanese games should stop taking "creative liberties" when translating and ruining the source product. If I wanted a fanfic, I'd read one.

> Monetisation model
Game comes at a industry standard 60 € price point (for EU). The special edition features some goodies and basic character recolors, I felt it wasn't worth buying those but feel free to support the devs if you'd like to.
The game features no MTX, no gacha elements, no time gated crap like season passes. You pay the game and get the complete package. The fact that this has to be written on a review really tells the story of how predatory the gaming industry is in the year 2024.

TL;DR
If you like action JRPGs / games in the style of MonHun, you will absolutely love this game. The combat and bosses are awesome, the visuals and artstyle are beautiful, the music breath taking. Performance, besides hicups on boot (which should've been fixed by the latest patch) is solid (stable 120FPS easily done on semi-modern hardware).

I try to avoid directly comparing games, as they can be different beasts, but I couldn't help thinking of Final Fantasy XVI as I played this main story. From a combat standpoint, I have the same complaint of occasionally finding it hard to tell what's going on through all the flashy effects, exacerbated by an awkward lock-on mechanic and camera. On the flip side, Relink's main story, though simple, is reminiscent of the cinematic adventure in FFXVI--minus the endless back-to-back cutscenes and repetitive padding that ruined the game for me. Relink keeps the plot simple, which works to its benefit. The soundtrack is incredible, making the most minor character interaction feel sentimental and adding blood-pumping stakes to the various exciting bosses and set pieces. Beautiful environments. 

I've yet to touch quests in co-op. Those instanced quests are my least favorite part of the game; you're ultimately just fighting the same enemies and bosses in the same levels from the main story. I'm glad the main story doesn't recycle much at all until the last chapter, but since co-op quests are meant to provide long-term playability, there should be plenty of unique assets.

Having so many characters who play differently from each other can help keep things fresh, however. It truly is a blast to try out new characters after sticking with one for a while. I wish Cygames could've managed to incorporate these unlocked characters in the main story more prominently, beyond just a line of dialogue here and there. It can feel jarring for the narrative to revolve around Gran/Djeeta while most players are a character whose existence isn't acknowledged by them or the cast. Not making the main story playable in co-op was also missed potential. 

For Cygames' first AAA effort, it's still excellent. I don't play gacha games, but this succeeds tenfold in convincing me that their world is cool and worth exploring in other games. Hopefully they keep the momentum going with Project Awakening and Garnet Arena (I'm more skeptical about that one with its mention of being multiplayer-focused).

Only had one crash, other than that this game ran perfect till the end.

AMAZING!! Action JRPG

Never played anything similar in regards to combat feel.

Is it the hardest? No. Is it the most complex? No. Does it feel the best? Absolutely yes.

Every character I've played feels so satisfying to play, it's incredible. Whoever did the VFX and SFX of this game is a genius.

So if you enjoy anime action games with sick boss fights, you can't skip this game at all.

The story is slightly above average, but it's carried by the awesome combat system and diverse cast of characters, once you reach post-story the main part of the game opens up accompanied by a great progression system, also narmaya's in the game.

To put it succinctly, I'd say it's a fantasy-themed Monster Hunter with a lengthy bit of obligatory story campaign.

Pros:
-Lots of fanservice for players already familiar with GBF
-Multiplayer is a fun variation on classic 4-player monster hunting, with hints of God Eater/Toukiden.
-The character growth is expansive, characters get be up to lvl 100, weapons can be even higher (200?)
-There sigil equip system is the avenue for playstyle customization that works with every character to an extent.

Cons:
-If you're trying to get to multiplayer quickly it's going to be a slog to start.
-Currently multiplayer is region-locked, although you can match steam download regions if you want to match with specific friends.
-Starting roster is a bit bland visually, despite having well-designed mechanics.

This review was previously negative, but they fixed my main problems with it. Now I can play and enjoy the game.

A lot of people compare this game to something like monster hunter due to the post game and coop features but for the most part the pre-post game plays more like an action hack n'slash that is boss focused. It is decently long and reviewing this as just an action singleplayer experience alone with the amazing setpieces, stellar bosses, and music is well worth it in my opinion (even if the story is generic). You do NOT need to be familiar with the source material to enjoy it. Straightforward, fun, and just an overall enjoyment of a ride.
Go on Hard, don't grind, and enjoy a great singleplayer campaign that goes crazy fun mid-late. 8.5/10.

As for the combat, it is fun and while the overall plot is pretty generic, many of the action sequences are actually varied and keep the game feeling fresh unlike other games. You are also encouraged to use various characters and while that is great, one flaw would be that some character kits feel a lot more empty or one dimensional, leading to them feeling a lot more boring to play vs. others. This is especially bad considering aside from the main roster these other characters require an earnable-through-progression ticket to unlock and so if your first pick was one of the boring ones it might feel like a slog. This is alleviated when you get to the later bosses both in terms of getting more characters as well as the bosses themselves which are insanely fun but I can definitely see some people getting frustrated if they were to pick a boring character. Each character's skill tree is also relatively short with branches only giving absurdly minor adjustments like 2% differences as you work you way down and as mentioned already some characters might have fun skills while others just get generic buffs/debuffs or non-interactive/flashy skills.

Overall though the game is great just in terms of its singleplayer story experience. Would definitely recommend to anyone who loves boss focused games or action hack n'slash. And if you aren't that kind of person and feel like you will never play the game even if it goes on sale later on--do yourself a favor and listen to the boss OSTs at the very least. They're great.

+The music is phenomenal. And on that note, there's a music player, which is a huge plus.

+The locations are beautiful.

+The visuals are striking.

+The boss fights are exciting.

+The characters and their designs are memorable.

+The English voice acting is fitting, and full of established voice actors that you're sure to recognize.

+The maps have hidden chests, collectibles, etc.

+The game performs really well, utilizing my resources beyond what most other games do, albeit at the price of making my rig a bit toasty.

+The ultimate moves, bullet time, and so on are so satisfying.

+The multiplayer is worthwhile.

Incredibly fun. The combat and spectacle really carries this game. The main plot is nothing to write home about but it does its job of introducing you to the vibe of the world quite nicely I feel and it doesn't overstay its welcome. Music is great too. If you love the anime fantasy aesthetic coupled with incredibly intuitive and fun gameplay you'll love this game.

Before I give my thoughts, I have to say the PC port of this game is very dubious and was clearly done either in haste or without much QA. A recent hotfix has made the game playable and fixed most of the major bugs but there are still some odd choices, such as the region-locked multiplayer and the fact that there's no native Dualshock support despite this game being on both PS4 and PS5 foremost. There are fixes for these issues though, so it's not all that bad.

The game itself, however, is fantastic. It handles well, feels well-balanced despite it being a party-based action RPG. Everything looks, feels, and runs incredibly smoothly, giving off a feeling of polish and the overall quality that  is sorely lacking nowadays.
Very well-made, even in spite of the shaky launch, and worth the wait. I just hope they continue to add content in the future.

Edit: Tentatively updating this review to positive as the most recent update appears to have fixed the issue for me. Was not only able to launch first try after the update with no issues, but I was able to play all the way through to the end of the first major boss with no crashes despite viewing multiple cut-scenes. Will keep the old review below just in case a shit launch is enough reason for you to not want to buy a game.

Was having a good time with the game (when I could actually get it to launch) until I hit a cut-scene crash in Chapter 1. The fact that I had to:

1) Launch the game as an admin.
2) Launch it in DX12 mode.
3) Disable every overlay (Steam, Discord, NVidia).
4) Disable my controller until AFTER it hit the start screen.
5) Not touch ANYTHING until the start screen showed.
6) SOMETIMES have a THIRD PARTY PROGRAM launched (Process Lasso) just to MONITOR the game to get it to launch.

Just to get the game going is absolutely bonkers. There's a "Known Issues" post and MAYBE a patch coming this weekend, but until they get their stuff together I'm gonna have to say your time and money is better spent elsewhere.

IF the game actually works, you've got a great game with fun, fluid combat, enjoyable characters, a great dub (if you're into that kind of thing), and plenty to do if you've got friends to play with. Gives some Monster Hunter-esque vibes where you can launch quests from a vendor in 4 player co-op and fight off hordes of baddies, kill giant raid bosses, etc. etc.

It's just a damn shame that I can't even get the game to work anymore, even after doing every fix under the sun.

it makes you feel pretty cool while youre playing it, i run it on hard and ive been having a blast with it. i dont know anything  about the franchise or whatnot so its a little annoying to hear them reference so many other things sometimes? but its cool the game is still fun and the story  is very anime general story. no complaints on that its just good to know what youre getting into. its very graphically impressive as well giving you seemingly tons of freedom. like selecting the party members. the multiplayer feature seems odd, i havent used it and i see no reason to.

Further impressions: so i think i was in chapter 4, and you know what this game is wickedly solid at giving you immersion.  it involves you in action that it could simply put in cutscenes.  not trying to spoiler much but your on an airship, and chasing another airship, theres other airships attacking, you have to board them take them out and escape. it was a wickedly thrilling and tense sequence and i think it really solidified the game as a seriously good one in my mind.

After finishing the main story (that 20 hours  is a joke i did it in ten? what makes it take longer?) the ending, really drags, theres a slog of huge boss fights, and well sheesh that can be punishing when its, like a dozen or so of them, perhaps more. SO YEAH that was kinda tedious to do all at once. anyway though, you get a nice wrap up and intro into the end game, the entire game is above satisfactory. as a person that never had even heard of the franchise this game made a good handshake to it. not that i would ever get invested in anything besides this game, but you get the sentiment. 

All good things aside really, its a solid AF game with tons of hack and slash rpg fun.

[h2]This review for game version 1.0.3[/h2]
[h3]Technical issues[/h3]
- Game freeze (or black screen) after see Cygames Logo, If there is an input key
- Some cut scene will make game crash if playing the game with borderless
-----------------------

Remark: I comment toward this game as a veteran player of mobile version. and also mainly play this game in Japanese because I know about issue about localization.

[h3]Main story[/h3]
I complete the main story in 12 hrs with a few side quests complete.
Main story lore is not interest. It just about power of [spoiler]friendship[/spoiler].

[h3]Good points[/h3]
- I have good first impression to the game visual that original web browser game with 2D visual can be transform into 3D Action game. No problem in lag spike or frame rate drop during heavy combat.
- The most fun parts are in quest board which use player skill only (assist mode does not allow in this content). 
- All characters are polished to have specific command button and play styles that player need to learn one-by-one.
- Cygames will add new update free contents as announced in road map and I believe there are more after the third update.
- AI likely play better than you.

[h3]As good as mobile[/h3]
- Signil (or Skill system) is similar to mobile version not complex
- End game contents are beyond level 100 while character max level is 100
- Grind hard (welcome to the rice field.)
- All quest boards are session quests, pickup the quest and facing the boss directly without exploration.

[h3]As bad as mobile[/h3]
In short, English localization still bad as same as mobile version.
- Chapter title between JP and EN are completely different.
- Some dialog talk mistranslate to something else.

[h3]Bad points[/h3]
- Boss combat flow is quite redundant (Boss appear -> No overdrive -> Overdrive -> run for your life without fightback -> Break -> no overdrive -> ...)
- No AI command for what they have to do specifically.

[h3]The worst points[/h3]
- Camera is the worst. For examples, The camera keep focusing the boss instead of incoming attack ground areas. The camera focusing at bad angle that make vision hard to estimate distance of incoming range attack
- In town navigator is useless, no information about distance to NPC just show up icon and let player find byself.
- Cannot change or remap for controller buttons
- Region lock in multiplayer and I cannot matchmaking.
- Some board quests are difficult or likely impossible to obtain max rank with solo play.
- All flying boss fight are not fun.

[h3]Etc.[/h3]
- During choice choosing in main story, Djeeta always has only one face expression.

-----------------------
[h3]Recommend decision[/h3]
Overall, I give recommend to this game.
- If you dont care about game story or you care only action part there is fine since the story is not attractive much.
- In case you interest the lore but cannot read japanese, you will confuse a lot because of bad English localization.

My current review of the game will change if they fix all the issues ruining the game.

The issues being:

- Frequent crashing especially during/after cut scenes: Had a situation where I had to beat a certain boss 3 times because the game kept freezing during a cut scene which I fixed by making sure I instantly skipped that cut scene the moment it showed and another where you couldn't skip the credits of the game because it would lead to a crash.

- Random Matchmaking takes forever to find a group: I feel like something like this shouldn't happen considering the game just came out. It would be great if they added an option to look at all available missions that are looking for a player to join them (i.e. SOS in MHW)

IT'S NOT ALL BAD THOUGH

- The boss fights are amazing and well thought out! Really enjoyed every encounter I had in the game

- The character roster is quite varied. With the amount of material they have to work thanks to the mobile game, I hope they bring a lot more characters in the pool we already have

- Story was short and sweet and it might be pretty simple and predictable but I enjoyed it nonetheless

- The environments are absolutely stunning and the fact that we don't get a map might be seen as a con but It promotes exploration and it personally made my experience quite enjoyable thanks to the little things I discover around the world


Overall, I feel like a lot of these issues were caused by problems with optimizing the game for PC players or it might be an issue with their servers.

I hope they fix all the problems so I can change my review :) GOOD LUCK CYGAMES!

Edit: THEY FIXED THE ISSUES I AM HAPPY NOW

Feb 3 - 12:15 am - patch dropped and immediately had no logo loading issue / cutscene i was stuck at loaded perfectly fine. recommendation moved to yes for the below mentioned good points. will potentially expand further on the review as i play further into the game.

this review is posted on Feb 1, 2024; at the time of writing i only give this game a thumbs down due to technical issues and would otherwise recommend it given future patches fixing current issues.

I can not in good faith recommend this game at the moment, not because i don't like it.

when the game runs, it's an extremely good time, with a lot of care put into the audio-visuals and general gamefeel. Progression seems like it will feel nice, gameplay is intuitive and feels good all around, with elements of the phone game it originates from being plentiful in ways that are well implemented.

however, at the time of writing, the game took roughly 30 minutes of effort to get to even boot past logos and even then it's a coin toss on whether or not it loads properly after that. Even still, after you get into the game you are at unknown risk to crashes that [seemingly] originate from cutscenes. all of the community ''fixes'' are  grasping at straws at best, some working for some others not. 

i'd say approximately an hour of my ''playtime'' is likely just wading through the game being unresponsive. That, on top of multiplayer region lock on *specifically* the steam port of the game is more than enough to hold off on buying.

the only other con i have at this time is a mild gripe with localization. I personally don't care if localizers take creative liberty on phrasing given that the original intent / 'vibe' of a line or character writing is retained or elevated in some way, it's innocuous most of the time. In this game it feels like localization occasionally loses the original 'tone' conveyed, but it's not a make or break thing.

tldr; if you wanna spin the wheel on whether or not you will have playability issues, it's a real good time. Otherwise don't risk it until Cygames puts out a patch that demonstrably fixes the above. [note; the team has put out notice that they are aware of issues, so it's a matter of waiting now]
Has as much grinding as the mobile game!

[h1] This game is absolute gas! [/h1]

This game is pure fun and a must play for anyone who enjoys a pure and clean action rpg!
The story keeps your attention even if it's a bit cliche in some ways but the real meat of the game is the action and everything surrounding it!

The bosses are some of the most fun and badass bosses I have ever fought in a video game! The spectacle of the bosses, their attacks, their music all of it is AMAZING and so damn fun to play against!

But all of that would mean nothing if it wasn't for the fluid, responsive, and most of all stylish actions you can preform with the many characters this game has on offer. Every single character plays uniquely from one another, with a different style of play for each of them! My current favorite is a character named Zeta who uses a spear and can loop bounce on any enemy infinitely as long as she lands the attack and you time the next one correctly, it is so damn fun!

After you beat the story there's a pretty hefty endgame grind if you're looking for it with some new bosses and some revamped bosses from the story to fight, as a big player of games like monster hunter and warframe i have been absolutely hooked to it. Though thats in large part to the stellar gameplay and unique styles of play the characters in the game have on offer which makes sure I'm never bored.

All in all I highly recommend this game, it is beyond fun and I look forward to every piece of content that they will eventually add to the game in the future!

Pros:
- Really fun for GBF fans with lots of fun and even more fanservice.
- Beautiful artstyle by Minaba Hideo (as usual) that captures the essence of GBF's universe.
- Engaging hack-and-slash gameplay, and I hate the HnS genre, so that's great.
- I really like the raids, they remind me a lot of a cross between MonHun and FFXIV.
- Incredible Music. the soundtrack elevates the overall gaming experience.
- Draws parallels with Dragalia Lost (RIP), offering a similar vibe to its midgame and endgame content.

Cons:
- Crashes during loading up to the main menu if you do as much as click a single button lol. and also after Chapter 1's cutscene.
- Platforming puzzles reminiscent of FFXIV, the bane of my existence.
- Auto-targeting issues with LT, which makes you unable to rotate the camera when locked on to something. trying to rotate with the right stick instead swaps target. This means you might swap to targeting a wall lol.
- Assumes players are already familiar with GBF's universe, which may be confusing for newcomers as some characters kinda just don't tell you anything and assume you already knew how you met etc.

final note:
Ignore the localization complaints; they're blown out of proportion. The game is perfectly enjoyable, and those nitpicking should calm the hell down, it's not that serious lol. Learn Japanese if you want to read the Japanese script and take a shower.

Completed main story in about 15 hours on hard mode, The endgame is basically grinding in order to achieve max level on your favorite characters. If you are someone who loves to min/max this game is for you. It has a Monster Hunter vibe during the endgame where you simply queue up to fight stuff to grind mats and get levels. 

Would love to see more content for endgame added in the future other than grinding. However, I am satisfied and will likely max out my favorite character before I put this on the shelf.

If you're thinking about buying this game I highly recommend looking into Tales of Arise. It has a significantly longer (and arguably) better main story at around 60 Hours on hardest difficulty.

For people looking to get the most out of their money i'd refer them to Arise.

Great game nonetheless.

Granblue fantasy: Relink is Action JRPG based of the mobile game of same name. The game has whole new storyline, so you don't need to play the mobile game to understand the story. The game also recap character backstory and lore nicely in non intrusive / artificial way.

Pros(+):
+ 18 Playable character with their own moveset and mechanic.
+ Quite wide variety of how you want to build the character.
+ Engaging boss battle with unique moveset.
+ Cutscene story isn't just bunch of character standing and talking(like g*nsh*n).
+ Good gameplay loop with "Monster hunter"esque mission based hunt.
+ Available in english and japanese voice.

Grey(*):
* Early game is quite slow, let it cook for atleast 2 hours.
* Not much of customizable look except for color palette.
* Unlocking character let you to skip grind as they're unlocked around your party level.

Cons(-):
- Performance dipping hard on some hardware.
- English translation is inaccurate with japanese voice.
- No native controller rebind option, even though it's made with controller in mind.

While the game is very good and really worth the full price, special edition on the other hand is really not worth it. As it gives booster material, color palette, and 1 weapon only MC can use. The inability to change controller key is also quite a let down. But the game is really recommended for JRPG or anime fan.

nb: please fire whoever did english translation.

Great game for Monster Hunter/Soulsborne enjoyers to play while waiting for the next titles; the story is good but just like Monster Hunter it exists to teach you the game and shuttle you to the endgame, the real grind is after the story. Despite the experience being great, there are several issues that I encountered: 
-There are issues with the steam overlay disconnecting the controls
-Keyboard and mouse is fairly clunky, use a controller
-Playstation controller routinely disconnects and won't work till you restart the game
-The campaigns hardest difficulty is too easy (Hard), it's borderline impossible to fail any quest even while neglecting other party members besides your own. It would be nice to have access to all of the difficulty settings from the very beginning.

Adjustable camera sensitivity, key mappings, skippable cutscenes, smooth combat, and one of the best levelling systems I've played. 

Haven't played it much but wanted to push reviews up for the weekend. For those coming from typical jrpg experiences, there isn't the typical issues you would expect in eg ateliar or neptunia, or even ff. Character design is awesome as always, you get 5 travel companions to create a party of 4 (incl you) for, the characters are actually decent in combat, with healers and aoe mages and etc. Limited skill points that you can use to boost yourself or your team mates (and they actually contribute to the fight so investment isn't wasted). You can jump over terrain cliffs and etc, and attack mid-flight holds your character position, so you can hit air targets. Character combat ai is surprisingly decent, I can trust my healer to keep me alive for instance.

Cutscenes are short and skippable but it's so good I watch them, which is really rare. Town interaction is fun, characters each have their own personality. Combat has link skills and your spells deal sufficient damage to make it worthwhile to use them but with a cd long enough to not spam. I did not come from a granblue background (think I played their mobile game tho) but the story is well introduced without being too naggy. 

In other words, this is as good as if not better than the latest ff, or whatever you choose to put your jrpg benchmark to be. Totally wasn't expecting it to be that good tbh. The dlcs just shorten the initial grind a little, up to you whether you want to go for them. 

To developers, the scene hangs a little when you combat ult, and the top level of mouse sensitivity could be higher, I'm maxing it out but I just wish it's a bit more sensitive.

This game is a sleeper hit of 2024. I bought this game after thorough research on if this game would be the "type" of game that I would enjoy. I enjoy games with cooperative battles, stand-out characters, and a bit of grinding. I really enjoyed games of the likes of Castlevania: Harmony of Despair, Warhammer Vermintide 2, and Monster Hunter World. I would thoroughly recommend this game if these things fit your gaming enjoyment. 

This game out-shined my expectations. All of the characters feel great to play and have a decent story behind them. Each one stands out. You also do not need to pull for any characters in a gacha format. All of the characters are made available to you right off the bat/by progressing the story. Speaking of that - the story is fantastic. The battles were memorable and the graphics/visuals were pleasing. I was also pleasantly surprised because I had read many reviews that the game was rather short. I found it to be a good length when playing on Hard mode. This is the type of game I wish received live service. Continuation of the fantastic story with additions of new characters and fights would be awesome. They could progress this story even further and keep adding new content making this game stand against popular games like Genshin Impact. If they keep their design/marketing/selling choice as well - this could become even better than those titles because people do not need to gamble for their characters. 

Regarding the functionality of the game - I encountered few to no bugs (at least, i never noticed or remembered any.) I also encountered no crashes or startup issues which some players said that they had. The game ran smoothly for me, however I do have newer end hardware. 

If you are on the fence about buying this game, I recommend that you pick it up. This game is even more fun with friends but - be warned - the story mode is only single player at the time of this review. The cooperative play comes later where you rematch bosses, play events and trials, and obtain more loot and drops. 

Thank you for reading!

I definitely recommend this game. Beautiful graphics and great environment design as well as nice character. The combat mechanic is fluid for a JARPG; even for heavy characters like Vaseraga does not feel clunky to play. The story is nothing too innovative but decent enough for you to follow the crew of Skyfarers to the end; and the cutscenes are just straight anime as fk (it's an anime game obviously).
As for the technical issues that alot of people had reported; strangely I did not encounter any of those since the first hour of launch; and I play on Ultra setting. Here is my PC specs: RTX 3070 with CPU intel i5. Despite that the devs has fully dealt with the issues after the feedback according to the Steam forums so it is all good.
As for how long you can invest into the game. The "Main" Story will take you around 20 hours; but you will like the contents that will open up after that; especially for anyone that likes the grind in JRPGs.

It is fun and engaging. So many ways to fight using many caracters. A lot of different combinations in your party. Stats and skills. Not much gear choice but you can still unlock new weapons. No crash after 12 hours and 6 chapters.

Game runs smoothly at 60 fps on my 2070 & i7-9700K, Solid 30 fps on standard settings on my deck without tweaking any settings on the deck itself.
Combat is really fun and bosses are some of the most fun I've had in an action RPG.
Character design is great, especially if you are a fan of ff 9 - 13.
So far my favorite game of 2024.

Game has very fun and fluent combat, An expansive skill tree for each characters and a pretty decent story. I just finished it and I do not regret purchasing it. Yeah there is censorship and it is pretty trash but that doesn't really take away from the gameplay itself. This game is the definitive Granblue experience, Way better then the fighting game although still not going back to that grindy ass slave simulator gacha game no matter what. Not entirely sure was postgame content is like yet but seems like there is still plenty to do. Also have yet to try online co-op. But yeah if you played the gacha game you will definitely enjoy this game I think.

Overall I've been loving the game, just beat chapter 3 as of this review. The combat is fast and fluid, the graphics are bright and full of colour! The English voice acting and English lines could be better, but they aren't horrible. THE MUSIC IS AWESOME! The characters all play well and have stuff that makes them unique, the menus and UI are all easy to navigate and understand.

Overall a 8 out of 10

Edit: i changed my review to 8 out of 10, because for some reason the PC version of the games multiplayer is region locked. Even though the Playstation version doesn't have region lock and allows you to pick your region in game whenever you want. There is a temporary fix, by going into steam settings and download settings, and then changing your download location to that of the location you want to play with. But its stupid that it is region locked in the first place.

Message to the devs: Please get rid of region lock for PC, unlock it how it is on Playstation.

Granblue Fantasy: Relink is a lot of fun.  Story is short and basic, but the characters are likable.  The main thing that makes this game shine is the gameplay, leveling system, and end game are handled.  Fun Combat, interesting bosses, lots of different characters to raise and gear.  For anyone who plays gacha games, its like playing one but being able to farm all the characters to max power with no time gating outside of the game time needed to gear and level up (no resin/stamina etc).  In a nutshell is basically what an awesome action based gacha game would like like if gacha didn't get in the way.  Happy to see Cygames move away from gacha to make this title.  Happy to support this move because I always found their character ip endearing and gameplay fun.

I normally don't write reviews, but I found the Relink to be a pleasant surprise, meeting and even surpassing my expectations in several areas. Relink shines with its fast-paced and responsive combat system. The variety of characters and their unique abilities add depth to the gameplay, allowing players to experiment and find their preferred playstyle. The multiplayer aspect is also pretty great, I've been able to play with friends from across the world with little to no lag whatsoever. Warning: you must be under the same download region (on steam) to match with your friends. 

Each boss encounter felt unique, with bosses showcasing distinct attack patterns, strengths, and weaknesses. There's a large variety in boss design, and each encounter genuinely felt pretty unique. While the game certainly has a few flaws, I think it's well worth the current price if you're a fan of Granblue and enjoy this style of game.

Didn't disappoint after 8 years. 9/10

+Polish and relatively bug free gameplay than most AAA games.
+Better version of the browser game mechanics(especially character acquisition)
+Graphics justify modern hardware(one of the most beautiful graphics I've ever seen but that's most likely because of the art direction).
+improved music and more voice acting work than the mobile game

-Gameplay is more casual than its competitors( though thats a good thing for some)
-Not enough characters at launch( 5 per element was ideal)
-Lockon system is an afterthought
-The grinding mechnics carried on from the mobile game
-Criminally inaccurate Japanese to EN translation for subtitles(no h8 on the english dub voices)
-Clothing censorship (nitpick)

In conclusion:
Get it now if you want a solid 2024 game and money is no object
Get it on sale if the cons greatly apply to you but still have some mild interest
If you like Final Fantasy 7 remake, and Tales of Arise you'll like this game. And its a good game in general.

มันคือ GrandBlue the Movie ในรูปแบบเกม   ที่อัดแน่นความมันแบบต่อเนื่องไม่ให้หายใจหายคอจนจบเกม   และมาพร้อมกับ ตัวละครสุดเท่มากกว่า 10 ตัวพร้อมเสียกพากษ์จากนักพากษ์ชื่อดัง   

review ในส่วน 20-25 ชม ในเการเล่น โหมดเนือเรื่อง

นิยามของเกมนี้  คือ hack and slash  ในรูปแบบ Party 4 คน    ที่ผสมรูปแบบเกมเพลย์หลายๆแบบเข้ามา   

จุดเด่นของเกมนี้
-กราฟิค งานศิลป์  สิ่งแวดล้อม  ทำออกมาโคตรดี
-ตัวละครเท่ๆ  เยอะมาก  มาพร้อมกับ  Move set แตกต่างกัน
-ระบบพัฒนาตัวละครแบบ   RPG   ที่ผู้เล่นสามารถ อัพสกิล  อัพเกรดอาวุธ และมีbuild ให้เลือก หลายแบบ  
-ระบบทีมแท๊คติค  ต้องมีการวางแผน เซท  ติดตั้งสกิลก่อนลงภารกิจ  
-ระบบล่ามอน และรวบรวมของ มาอัพเกรด
-ระบบ coop  online 4 คน
-ระบบ แพ้ทาง ด้วยธาตุ  และการต่อสู้กับบอสสุดมัน และอลังการ
-ระบบภารกิจที่มีประมาณ 6 รูปแบบ ให้ผู้เล่นได้เล่น
-ระบบ ช่วยเหลือผู้เล่นที่อยากสนุกกับเนื้อหาในเกม   แต่เล่นเกม  action ไม่เก่งตัวเกมก็มีระบบ Ai มาช่วยเล่นแทนแต่ผู้เล่นยังต้องบังคับการเดินไปมา  และใช้ได้แค่ระดับความยาก ธรรมดา

Gameplay หลักๆ
ตัวเกมจะให้ผู้เล่นเลือก  ตัวละครในทีม มาจัดตั้ง Party 4 ในการทำภารกิจ  และลูกทีมแต่ละคนจะมีความสามารถแตกต่างตั้งแต่
combo  สกิลโจมตี  , passive และธาตุ   เมื่อเซททีมเสร็จผู้เล่นก็เอาทีมไปลุยภารกิจ  เมื่อจบภารกิจ และจะได้สิ่งตอบแทนมา  เป็นเงิน  exp  แต้มสกิล   ไอเทมอัพเกรดอาวุธ  และอุปกรณ์เสริมพลัง แบบสุ่ม   ตัวเกมจะให้ผู้เล่นทำภารกิจ ไปเรื่อยๆ เพื่อปลด lock level และเนื้อหาใหม่ๆ   โดย mission ที่เตรียมไว้มีประมาณ 6 ประเภทเช่น  จัดบอส  ป้องกัน   เอาตัวรอดมอนเตอร์เป็นเวฟ 

ระบบความยากและความลึกของเกม
ในการต่อสู้  ผู้เล่นต้องวางแผนตั้งแต่เลือกสมาชิกในทีม และจัด Gear item  ให้เหมาะกับภารกิจที่ลง  เพราะมอนเตอร์จะมีการแพ้ทางธาตุแตกต่างกัน   ความเร็วในการจัดการมอนเตอร์จะส่งผลต่อ  Rank ในการจบมิชชัน   และบางภารกิจก็ต้องมีจอมเวท ทีมีสกิล AOE หรือ CC ไว้จัดการมอนกลุ่มใหญ่  ถ้าผู้เล่นจัดทีมแบบตีประชิดหมด เอาโดนหลุดจนเควสล่ม หรือได้ Rank น้อยตอนจบภารกิจ   


ข้อเสียที่เจอตอนนี้
1.bug  จอดำหลักจบคัทซีน เจอ 2 ครั้งแต่เล่นจบ  ทำให้ต้องกลับไปเล่นใหม่อีกรอบจาก Save ล่าสุด  
2.bug  เข้าหน้า title game ไม่ได้ เจอ 1 ครั้ง   แก้โดยการรีคอม
3.ระบบวิ่งเก็บกล่องที่น่าเบื่อ   การของรางวัลที่ได้
4.ระบบ  บอสลับตามฉาก   ที่ทำเพื่ออะไรไม่รู้ในตอนต้นเกม  มันดูไม่ค่อยสมดุล     มันควรในรอบ Replay หรือไม่ต้องมีก็ได้  เ


สรุปสั้นๆ    เกมเพลย์แมมโคตรมัน  กราฟฟิคและดีไซน์ตัวละครโคตรเท่   เนื้อเรื่องแบบ The Movie มาเป็นของแถม

This is just my initial 5 hours of playing so any of my opinions in this matter are subject to change when i get to the end game. This game is stunning especially in the audio/graphical department. Game play is snappy and fun, on hard I've had a couple of fights that actually were tough and engaging but in my estimation never felt unfair and annoying. I understand that this game has been crashing for some people and that's a real shame, hopefully the devs buckle down and fix those issues so people can enjoy this game as much as I have. I really hope the devs keep updating this game and they actually promote this game harder. I think that this game is (so far) a great and enjoyable time at this time I could absolutely recommend but I will say read the negative reviews in regard to the potential crashes. I cant say much about the mp aspect of the game, i haven't engaged with that portion yet but my first impressions still stand. Fun time so far!

EDIT: The story was just the tutorial of the game 10 outa 10

I have spent 12 hours running through the story and so far has been amazing. Fantastic gameplay and beautiful anime style combat. The story seems like a continuation of the anime, so I was a bit confused with the story until I watched the anime. The multiplayer team synergy being important is also a plus with how you can bring unique skill, and move around sigils to suit your playstyle. So many characters to choose from. Potion being replenished each fight is so convenient. Super cute emoji and players interactions. The downside i have seen so far is the clunky camera (will get used to it eventually but still annoying), and the search online party still have connection issues sometimes. Would be nice if they implement voice chat as well.
Story 6/10
Animation/Design 8/10
Gameplay 9/10
Multiplayer Experience 7/10
Replayability 8/10
Customization 8/10
